result.execSummary:
The defendant Lydia Jean Haney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*Referred to mental health unit of probation.

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lydia Jean Haney in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for zero  time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:
*referred to mental health unit of probation
*no new tickets of retail thefts 
*60 days condition time with release privileges for the benedict center, court objects to es and stays the commencment until 10-1-15
*pay all mandatory costs, fees and dna surcharges from bail and balance during term of probation or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant
Court will consider waiving costs if defendant does not collect SSI

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Violation report received and filed. lr

Defendant Lydia Jean Haney in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justice point report received and filed.   Court ordered stayed   warrant cancelled.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch  47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM034198  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-20-2015

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant's appearance waived. Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Calendar call scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Lydia Jean Haney not in court, in custody. Takia Burris, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Status Conference. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart located at 5825 W. Hope Avenue, Milwaukee,WI.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and breathalyzer. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lydia Jean Haney in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Lydia Jean Haney in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
